intro: Psychotria ulviformis, commonly known as the "Devil's Tongue," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria ulviformis is also notable for its psychoactive properties, containing compounds like dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
